description.original_author: Universidad Pública de Navarra - Complejo Hospitalario de Navarra
description.other_contributors: Jose Andonegui Navarro, Complejo Hospitalario de Navarra, Spain

details.purpose: Register details about a study involving thickness measurement for specific ophthalmic structures.
details.use: To specify the strategy to schedule a ophthalmic thickness study, but also to record the procedure as well as clinical findings obtained once the study has been completed.

details.purpose: Registrar los detalles de estudios que incluyan medidas de espesor de estructuras oftálmicas específicas.

items.items: Registro de los hallazgos clínicos referentes a la medida de espesor de estructuras oftálmicas.

*A slit reflected light microscope, which has the ability to form an image of the back scattered light from the eye in a sagittal plane. Scheimpflug cameras are able to achieve a wide depth of focus by employing the “Sheimpflug principle” where the lens and image planes are not parallel with each other. Rotating Sheimplug cameras are able to generate three-dimensional images and calculate measurements of the anterior chamber of the eye. Corresponds to DICOM Code value 111626.(es)

*A device that measures corneal anterior surface shape using elevation-based methods (stereographic and light slit-based). Rasterstereography images a grid pattern illuminating the fluorescein dyed tear film with 2 cameras to produce 3D. Slit-based devices scan the cornea, usually by rotation about the instrument axis centered on the cornea vertex. Corresponds to DICOM Code value 111945.(es)

*A reflection-based device that projects a pattern of light onto the cornea and an image of the reflection of that pattern from the tear film is recorded in one video frame. Light patterns include the circular mire pattern (Placido disc) and spot matrix patterns. Sequential scanning of light spots reflected from the corneal surface is also used requiring multiple video frames for recording. Corresponds to DICOM Code value 111946.(es)

*An Interference-based device that projects a beam of light onto and through the cornea. Light reflected from within the cornea is combined with a reference beam giving rise to an interference pattern. Appropriately scanned, this imaging is used to construct 3-dimensional images of the cornea from anterior to posterior surfaces. E.g., swept source OCT. Corresponds to DICOM Code value 111947.(es)
*Test acquired on both eyes of the patient.(es)
Record of clinical findings related to measurement of thickness upon ophthalmic structures.
Identifies the type of acquisition device chosen to provide the thickness measurements.
The acquisition method used to obtain the ophthalmic thickness map.
Corresponds to the (0022,1420) attribute. Values permitted are defined by DICOM standard (supplement 152) inside the table with Context ID 4261 (Ophthalmic Mapping Acquisition Method).
Specifies the meaning of the pixel values provided.
Corresponds to the (0022,1436) attribute. Values permitted are defined by DICOM standard (supplement 152) inside the table with Context ID 4263 (Ophthalmic Thickness Map Value Type).
Identifies the normative data set used (if any) to contrast the absolute ophthalmic thickness measurements obtained in the study.
Specifies which layers of the retina are included in the thickness measurement.
Corresponds to the (0022,1445) attribute. Values permitted are defined by DICOM standard (supplement 152) inside the table with Context ID 4262 (Retinal Thickness Definition).
Parameters resulting from thickness measurements carried out upon the optic disk.
Area of the optic disk in mm2.
Cup area inside the optic disc in mm2.
Measurement of the neural rim area inside the optic disc in mm2.
Cup volume measured inside the optic disc in mm3.
Neural rim volume measured inside the optic disc in mm3.
Ratio obtained from cup and disc area values.

average of the cup/disc diameter ratios (square root of cup/disc area ratio). The linear cup/disc ratio should be similar to the clinician’s assessment of cup/disc ratio, as it is an average of all cup/disc ratio measures along all the meridians.
Diameter of the optic disk in the axis perpendicular to macula.
Diameter of the optic disk in the axis paralel to macula.
Parameters resulting from thickness measurements carried out upon the macula.
Average value of thickness for every value measured on the current thickness map.
Average value of thickness for every value measured on a comparative thickness map, obtained measuring thickness changes during a follow-up study.
Object that encloses the image of an ophthalmic thickness map.
Is the thickness ratio obtained from the total inner ring to the total outer ring on a ETDRS grid (centered over the macula).
Is the volume ratio obtained from the total inner ring to the total outer ring on a ETDRS grid (centered over the macula).
Identifies the use of physical signals with respect to time to capture information (DICOM Code value 111920).
Identifies the use of physical signals with respect to multiple frequencies to capture information (DICOM Code value 111921).
No compensation algorithm for corneal birefringence (DICOM Code value 111922).
Algorithm to compensate for variability in corneal birefringence (DICOM Code value 111923).
Measurement of the retinal surface contour relative to an assigned datum plane (DICOM Code value 111924).
Thickness of a component of the posterior segment of the eye. For example, thickness of retina, choroid, etc. Corresponds to DICOM Code value 111930.
Thickness deviation category from normative data
Ophthalmic thickness map based upon statistical significance category (such as percentile) from a normative data set. Corresponds to DICOM Code value 111931.
Ophthalmic thickness map based upon deviation (such as microns) from a normative data set. Corresponds to DICOM Code value 111932.

Measurement approximating the distance related to the structure between the internal limiting membrane (ILM) and the outer boarder of the retinal nerve fiber layer (RNFL). Corresponds to DICOM Code value 111925.

Measurement approximating the distance related to the structure between the ILM and the outer border of the inner plexiform layer (IPL), called the ganglion cell complex (GCC). Corresponds to DICOM Code value 111926.
Measurement approximating the distance related to the structure between the ILM and the inner-outer segment junction (IS-OS). Corresponds to DICOM Code value 111927.
Measurement approximating the distance related to the structure between the ILM and the retinal pigment epithelium (RPE). Corresponds to DICOM Code value 111928.
Corresponds to DICOM Code value A-00FBE.
Corresponds to DICOM Code value R-FAB5A.
Corresponds to DICOM Code value A-00E8B.

A slit reflected light microscope, which has the ability to form an image of the back scattered light from the eye in a sagittal plane. Scheimpflug cameras are able to achieve a wide depth of focus by employing the “Sheimpflug principle” where the lens and image planes are not parallel with each other. Rotating Sheimplug cameras are able to generate three-dimensional images and calculate measurements of the anterior chamber of the eye. Corresponds to DICOM Code value 111626.
Corresponds to DICOM Code value A-00E8C.

A device that measures corneal anterior surface shape using elevation-based methods (stereographic and light slit-based). Rasterstereography images a grid pattern illuminating the fluorescein dyed tear film with 2 cameras to produce 3D. Slit-based devices scan the cornea, usually by rotation about the instrument axis centered on the cornea vertex. Corresponds to DICOM Code value 111945.

A reflection-based device that projects a pattern of light onto the cornea and an image of the reflection of that pattern from the tear film is recorded in one video frame. Light patterns include the circular mire pattern (Placido disc) and spot matrix patterns. Sequential scanning of light spots reflected from the corneal surface is also used requiring multiple video frames for recording. Corresponds to DICOM Code value 111946.

An Interference-based device that projects a beam of light onto and through the cornea. Light reflected from within the cornea is combined with a reference beam giving rise to an interference pattern. Appropriately scanned, this imaging is used to construct 3-dimensional images of the cornea from anterior to posterior surfaces. E.g., swept source OCT. Corresponds to DICOM Code value 111947.
Measurement approximating the distance related to the structure between the ILM and the Bruch's membrane (BM). Corresponds to DICOM Code value 111929.
Test acquired on both eyes of the patient.
Overall settings chosen to conduct the test.
Findings and results from the thickness measurement study.
